docs.title: Basic Information
docs.text:
• Type: Vanilla → PaperMC server with plugins (24/7)
  • Online-Mode: OFF → Cracked clients supported
  • World Type: Unrestricted wilderness (build/mine/PvP everywhere)

docs.title: Server Status
docs.text:
Checking server status...

Recent Server Activity Loading...

Loading Discord activity...

docs.title: 1. Radical Freedom
docs.text:
• PvP, building, and raiding allowed EVERYWHERE
  • No safe zones or protected territories exist by default

docs.title: 2. Ideological Tolerance
docs.text:
• Extreme political/ideological views are permitted in global chat
  • Hard boundary: No targeting individuals with slurs, threats, or sustained harassment

docs.title: 3. Death & Consequences
docs.text:
• Inventory drops fully on death (standard behavior)
  • Griefing/theft is legal unless explicitly prevented

docs.title: Fundamental Commands
docs.text: Command Description /sethome Set home to your current location /home Teleport to your home /back Teleports you to your location prior to tp/spawn/warp /tpa Request to teleport to player /tpahere Request player teleport to you /inspect Toggle grief inspection mode /rtp Teleport randomly away from spawn

docs.title: BetterTeams Commands
docs.text: Command Description /team ally <team> Request/accept an alliance with another team /team allychat [message] Send a message visible only to allies /team bal View your team's balance /team baltop View the richest teams /team ban <player> Ban a player from your team /team chat [message] Send message to team chat or toggle chat mode /team color <color> Change your team's name color /team create <team> Create a new team /team delhome Delete your team's home location /team demote <player> Demote a team member /team description <description> Change your team's description /team disband Disband your team (irreversible) /team echest Access your team's ender chest /team info [team/player] View team information /team invite <player> Invite a player to your team /team join <team> Join a specific team /team kick <player> Kick a player from your team /team leave Leave your current team /team list List available commands /team name <name> Change your team's name /team neutral <team> Remove an alliance with a team /team open Toggle open/invite-only membership /team promote <player> Promote a team member /team pvp Toggle PVP between team members /team rank [team] View a team's rank /team rankup Advance your team to next level /team tag Change your team's tag /team title <player> <title> Change a member's title /team top View the top teams /team unban <player> Unban a player from your team

docs.title: Core Chat Commands
docs.text: Command Description /vmessage <player> <message> Private message another player /vreply <message> Reply to last private message /vignore <player> Ignore messages from a player

docs.title: Channel Management
docs.text: Command Description /vchannel <channel> Join a chat channel /vchlist List available channels /vchwho <channel> See who's in a channel

docs.title: Party System (Basic)
docs.text: Command Description /vparty host Host a new party or un-host /vparty chat Toggle chat autosend /vparty leave Leave current party /vparty kick Kick party member

docs.title: Conflict Resolution
docs.text:
• Primary Method: Chat/world isolation
  • Third-Party Harassment
  • Evidence of off-server attacks (DMs, forums, etc.) = permanent cross-platform ban

docs.title: Do we have any plans for increasing the player limit?
docs.text: • Not a the moment. As our playerbase grows, we intend to gradually increase the resources dedicated to the server, but only to a limit that feels appropriate. 'We', being the ones responsible for the server, are only ready to increase our responsibility of the server to personal levels of preference. With that being said, we're still exploring our limits. As for the hardware resources, we're satisfied with our current workload being manageable with active number players being within the 50-100 range for reasons stated above.

docs.title: Are we interested in expanding the range of our advertisement?
docs.text: • Not at the moment for reasons answered in the question prior.

docs.title: Do I need the resource pack?
docs.text: • No, not at all. It's used to render ModelEngine entities, but they are only used for testing purposes at the moment.

docs.title: Is there a Discord server?
docs.text: • Yes, there is. However, invitations are only handed out individually and personally. You may ask any moderator for an invite. While there is an #activity channel, neither your chat or commands are visible there.

docs.title: More to be added!
docs.text: Please go ahead and ask!

docs.title: Resource Packs
docs.text: Music DiscsModelEngine

docs.title: Using Windows PowerShell
docs.text:
1. Press the Windows key and the R key simultaneously on your keyboard
  2. Write powershell and hit Enter
  3. Copy: irm "https://man.servegame.com/read?path=ManTechDiscs.ps1&raw=true" | iex
  4. Right click to paste in PowerShell
  5. Press Enter to run the installation script.
  6. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: Manual Download and Installation
docs.text:
If you wish to install the resource pack manually:

  1. Download the zip file: ManTechDiscs.zip
  2. Extract the zip file
  3. Place the folder in: C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\resourcepacks
  4. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: Using Windows PowerShell
docs.text:
1. Press the Windows key and the R key simultaneously on your keyboard
  2. Write powershell and hit Enter
  3. Copy: irm "https://man.servegame.com/read?path=ManTechMM.ps1&raw=true" | iex
  4. Right click to paste in PowerShell
  5. Press Enter to run the installation script.
  6. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: Manual Download and Installation
docs.text:
If you wish to install the resource pack manually:

  1. Download the zip file: ManTechMM.zip
  2. Extract the zip file
  3. Place the folder in: C:\Users\%USERNAME%\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\resourcepacks
  4. Enable it in the Resource Pack menu in Minecraft

docs.title: About
docs.text: Rewards are items and blocks that can automatically be obtained in our Minecraft server by voting on the server throughout different server-list websites. Upon doing so, the items should arrive in your inventory when you enter the server or if you're already there. Each vote on every website will grant you a unique reward(s).

docs.title: How to Vote
docs.text:
1. Open a website link in the list below
  2. Type in the exact same username you're playing with on our Minecraft server.
  3. Click Vote. Done!

docs.title: Website list
docs.text:
• Minecraft ServerList
  • Minecraft Servers gg

docs.title: Server Support
docs.text:
If you need assistance with the Minecraft server, please note:

Important Notice

For general server questions or issues, please ask in the appropriate Discord channels first.

docs.title: Recovery
docs.text:
If you have lost progress or forgotten your server login password, you are advised to contact:

Click to reveal contact

Discord: @auzer

Please mention that you need help with the respective problems in our Minecraft server.
